title: Nottinghamshire close on title against Warwickshire: county cricket final round – live
summary: Tanya Aldred will provide live updates from various grounds during the final matches of the County Championship season. Fans can expect the latest news and highlights as teams compete for the last time this season. Stay tuned for comprehensive coverage of all the action.

title: Sarkozy says he will ‘sleep in prison, but with head held high’ following guilty verdict in Libya trial – Europe live
summary: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy has been convicted of criminal conspiracy for illegally receiving funding from the late Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi. He faces custodial time despite plans to appeal the conviction. This ruling marks a significant downfall for Sarkozy, who previously served as the head of state from 2007 to 2012.

title: Fema’s acting chief reportedly could not be reached during deadly Texas floods
summary: A disaster relief agency faced backlash for its slow response during a recent crisis, prompting scrutiny of its operations. Reports indicate that the agency failed to answer two-thirds of incoming calls for assistance. This has raised concerns about its effectiveness in providing timely support during emergencies.

title: Demand for UK government debt falls; Jaguar Land Rover and Co-op count cost of cyber-attacks – business live
summary: Co-op estimates that a recent hack could result in a £120 million loss in profits this year. Meanwhile, there are calls for government assistance to support Jaguar Land Rover's suppliers during their shutdown. The situation highlights increasing concerns over cybersecurity and supply chain stability.

title: Former FBI director James Comey expected to be indicted on criminal charges, reports say – US politics live
summary: James Comey, the former FBI director, has been a target of Donald Trump's criticism since he was dismissed from his position in the early days of Trump's presidency. Trump's dissatisfaction with Comey has been a recurring theme over the years. The focus on Comey underscores ongoing tensions between the former president and law enforcement agencies.
